benchmark_details.name: RULEARN
benchmark_details.overview: RULEARN is a novel benchmark to assess the rule-learning abilities of LLM agents in interactive settings through strategic interactions with simulated environments to gather observations and solve complex problems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The goal of the benchmark is to provide a challenging resource for evaluating the rule-learning capabilities of LLM agents in fully interactive environments.

data.source: 300 high-quality manually created puzzles with hidden rules set in a text-based environment.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the success rate of LLM agents in solving puzzles over benchmark interactions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher success rates indicate better rule-learning capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against baseline agents without the proposed IDEA reasoning framework.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through experiments with human participants and various LLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data in RULEARN contains no personal or sensitive information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was obtained from all human participants.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The project is approved by the Institutional Review Board (IRB).
